definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: It's a satisfying ritual of continuity and caretaking.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種令人心滿意足的連續性和照料的儀式。

sentences.english: The girl smiled even more sweetly and more complacently. She liked a crystal at least I think.
sentences.chinese: 女孩更加心滿意足地笑了，她的笑如水晶一般。

sentences.english: I took one guiltily, lit it and smoked with satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 我內疚地接過一支點上，心滿意足地抽起來。

sentences.english: Not that I'd ever sated that curiosity in my boy-free teen years.
sentences.chinese: 不像我在十幾歲那時，身邊沒有男孩也一樣心滿意足。

sentences.english: Happiness is a state of fullness which is both pleasant and satisfying.
sentences.chinese: 幸福是一種圓滿的狀態，心滿意足，稱心又如意。
僅是聲音便讓人心滿意足。

sentences.english: I'll settle for an "A" in my photography course.
sentences.chinese: 我能在我的攝影課上得個“A”就已經心滿意足了。

sentences.english: Most commoners are satisfied with landlines we have.
sentences.chinese: 對多數普通人來說，擁有固定電話就心滿意足了。

sentences.english: You looked at the grinning , I will be satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 看着笑嘻嘻的你們，我也就心滿意足了。

sentences.english: I would have settled for brown.
sentences.chinese: 本來你說棕色我就心滿意足了。

sentences.english: Susan insisted, however, that the happiness she brought Gena is reward enough.(See photo)
sentences.chinese: 而婆婆蘇珊堅稱，看到吉娜幸福就已心滿意足。

sentences.english: Looking at a beautiful painting always gives one satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 觀看一幅美麗的圖畫常使人心滿意足。

sentences.english: They feel fully satisfied even if they have to eat little food and wear shabby clothes .
sentences.chinese: 縱使是食不果腹，衣不蔽體，他們也心滿意足。

sentences.english: I took one guiltily , lit it and smoked with satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 我內疚地接過一枝點上，心滿意足地抽起來。

sentences.english: She sighed as she thought of her handsome adorer.
sentences.chinese: 想到她的英俊的情人，她心滿意足地嘆息了一聲。

sentences.english: Obsolete To fill with sublime emotion; elate.
sentences.chinese: 使充滿崇高的感情，鼓舞，使心滿意足。

definition: happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
to return from a rewarding journey
easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
